revision.comment: /* Personal life */ how is this remarkable?
revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Tim Ream | image = TimReam (cropped).jpg | image_size = | fullname = Timothy Michael Ream<ref name="Premier League Clubs submit Squad Lists">{{Cite news |title=Premier League Clubs submit Squad Lists |url=http://www.premierleague.com/content/dam/premierleague/site-content/News/publications/squad-lists/squad-lists-february-2012.pdf |format=PDF |publisher=The Football Association |date=February 2, 2012 |accessdate=February 3, 2012}}</ref> | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1987|10|5}} | birth_place = [[St. Louis]], [[Missouri]], United States | height = {{convert|1.86|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/player-profiles/tim-ream |title=Tim Ream |publisher=Fulham F.C. |accessdate=July 6, 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] | clubnumber = 13 | youthyears1 = 2003–2005 | youthclubs1 = [[St. Louis Scott Gallagher Soccer Club|St. Louis Scott Gallagher]] | collegeyears1 = 2006–2009 | college1 = [[Saint Louis Billikens men's soccer|Saint Louis Billikens]] | collegecaps1 = | collegegoals1 = | years1 = 2008–2009 | clubs1 = [[Chicago Fire Premier]] | caps1 = 19 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2010–2011 | clubs2 = [[New York Red Bulls]] | caps2 = 58 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2012–2015 | clubs3 = [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] | caps3 = 114 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015– | clubs4 = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] | caps4 = 123 | goals4 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2010– | nationalteam1 = [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] | nationalcaps1 = 26 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | medaltemplates = {{MedalCountry|{{USA}}}} {{Medal|RU|[[CONCACAF Gold Cup]]|[[2011 CONCACAF Gold Cup|2011]]}} {{MedalSport|Men's [[Association football|Soccer]]}} | club-update = 08:53, 10 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = September 1, 2017 }} '''Timothy Michael Ream''' (born October 5, 1987) is an American [[association football|soccer]] player who plays for [[Premier League]] club [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] and the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States national team]]. A left-footed player traditionally used as a central defender, he also plays left back.
==Career== ===Youth and college=== Born in [[Saint Louis, Missouri|Saint Louis]], [[Missouri]], Ream was a 2005 NSCAA All-Midwest Region selection with his high school, [[St. Dominic High School (O'Fallon, Missouri)|St. Dominic]], and after finishing his career with 15 goals and a school-record 39 assists, was tabbed All-State, All-Conference and Class 2 Defensive Player of the Year in both 2004 and 2005, was a St. Louis Post-Dispatch All-Metro selection and garnered Archdiocesan Athletic Association Player of the Year honors following senior season. He helped lead St. Dominic to the 2004 Missouri Class 2 state title. Ream also played with academy club [[St. Louis Scott Gallagher Soccer Club|St. Louis Scott Gallagher SC]], winning national championships in 2003 and 2004.
Ream attended [[Saint Louis University]] where he was a regular figure as a defender for the [[Saint Louis Billikens]], earning NSCAA first-team All-Region and second-team All-Conference honors. During his college years Ream also played for [[Chicago Fire Premier]] in the [[USL Premier Development League]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uslsoccer.com/teams/13381239/22315-13381307/10355035.html |title=United Soccer Leagues (USL) |publisher=Uslsoccer.com |date= |accessdate=January 26, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120711123416/http://www.uslsoccer.com/teams/13381239/22315-13381307/10355035.html |archivedate=July 11, 2012}}</ref>
===New York Red Bulls=== {{Quote_box| width=40% |align=right |quote="He has a future. I probably shouldn't say too much, but Ream has a chance to be a national team player. He's a center back who is comfortable and calm in possession of the ball. He plays a good passing game, he's an excellent passer. A European-type center back who, I think, reminds me of Rio Ferdinand in the Premier League. Ream is strong tactically and never stressed, and of course he's good in the air. He has a top-class attitude and spirit." |source= -Red Bulls coach [[Hans Backe]] speaking about Tim Ream, March 17, 2010 <ref>{{cite news |url=http://goal.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/03/17/red-bulls-coach-likes-one-young-defender-in-particular/ |work=The New York Times |first=Jack |last=Bell |title=Red Bulls Coach Likes One Young Defender in Particular |date=March 17, 2010}}</ref> |}}
Ream was drafted in the second round (18th overall) of the [[2010 MLS SuperDraft]] by [[New York Red Bulls]].<ref>[http://web.mlsnet.com/mls/events/superdraft/2010/draft_tracker.jsp 2010 MLS SuperDraft] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100117173019/http://web.mlsnet.com/mls/events/superdraft/2010/draft_tracker.jsp |date=January 17, 2010 }}</ref> His play during pre-season impressed many observers, including new coach Hans Backe who was pleased with his distribution and tactical awareness.
On March 20, 2010, Ream started and played the full 90 minutes for Red Bulls in a 3–1 victory against [[Santos FC]], which was the first match played at the new [[Red Bull Arena (Harrison)|Red Bull Arena]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bigapplesoccer.com/article.php?article_id=22956 |title=THE STARTING XI Salou, Kandji partner up top |publisher=Bigapplesoccer.com |date=March 20, 2010 |accessdate=January 26, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029201611/http://www.bigapplesoccer.com/article.php?article_id=22956 |archivedate=October 29, 2013}}</ref> He made his professional debut on March 27, 2010, playing the full 90 in New York's opening game of the [[2010 Major League Soccer season|2010 MLS season]] against [[Chicago Fire Soccer Club|Chicago Fire]] that ended in a 1–0 victory for New York.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/gamecast?id=289679&cc=5901&league=USA.1 |title=Gamecast: New York Red Bulls v Chicago – Major League Soccer – ESPN Soccernet |publisher=Soccernet.espn.go.com |date=March 27, 2010 |accessdate=January 26, 2012}}</ref> On September 11, 2010, he scored his first professional goal (and MLS goal) against the [[Colorado Rapids]] in a 3–1 win for [[New York Red Bulls]]. Ream ended his first professional season starting all 30 matches for New York and helped New York capture its second regular season [[2010 Major League Soccer|Eastern Conference]] title.<ref>[http://www.mlssoccer.com/matchcenter-recap/red-bulls-beat-revs-clinch-eastern-conference ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101023070503/http://www.mlssoccer.com/matchcenter-recap/red-bulls-beat-revs-clinch-eastern-conference |date=October 23, 2010 }}</ref> Upon the conclusion of the 2010 season, he was named the team's Defender of the Year, and he was one of three listed candidates for [[MLS Rookie of the Year]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.newyorkredbulls.com/post/2010/10/12/new-york-red-bulls-2010-mls-season-awards-contenders |title=New York Red Bulls 2010 MLS Season Awards Contenders |publisher=New York Red Bull Official Website |date=October 12, 2010 |accessdate=July 1, 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160701205837/http://www.newyorkredbulls.com/post/2010/10/12/new-york-red-bulls-2010-mls-season-awards-contenders |archivedate=July 1, 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.newyorkredbulls.com/post/2010/11/19/red-bulls-announce-2010-team-awards |title=Red Bulls announce 2010 team awards |publisher=New York Red Rulls Official Website |date=November 19, 2010 |accessdate=July 1, 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160322023644/http://www.newyorkredbulls.com/post/2010/11/19/red-bulls-announce-2010-team-awards |archivedate=March 22, 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
During Ream's second season in New York, he played and started in 28 of 34 matches during the regular season; he missed 6 matches largely due to international call-ups during the [[2011 CONCACAF Gold Cup]].
In December 2011, during the [[Major League Soccer|MLS]] off-season, Ream spent a short time training with both [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] and [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] with permission from the Red Bulls to maintain his fitness during the winter break.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2074044/West-Brom-Bolton-warned-Tim-Ream.html |title=West Brom and Bolton warned off Tim Ream | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=December 15, 2011 |accessdate=January 26, 2012}}</ref> At the beginning of January 2012, Bolton made a transfer offer of £2.5m for him.<ref>{{cite web |author=Trotters move for American |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/12691/7415635/Bolton-launch-Ream-bid |title=Bolton launch Ream bid | Latest Football Transfer News |publisher=Sky Sports |date=January 6, 2012 |accessdate=January 26, 2012}}</ref> The bid was accepted and after personal terms were agreed he received a work permit on January 24.<ref>{{cite web |author=Holden welcomes arrival of fellow USA international |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11672/7452668/Ream-granted-work-permit- |title=Ream 'granted work permit' | Bolton Wanderers News, Fixtures, Results, Transfers |publisher=Sky Sports |date=January 26, 2012 |accessdate=January 26, 2012}}</ref>
===Bolton Wanderers=== [[File:Ream, Tim.jpg|thumb|right|Ream playing for [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] in 2015]] Bolton completed the signing of Ream on January 26, 2012 on a three-and-a-half year deal.<ref>{{cite web |author=Trotters land defender on a three-and-a-half-year deal. |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11672/7456386/Ream-completes-Bolton-move |title=Ream completes Bolton move | Bolton Wanderers News, Fixtures, Results, Transfers |publisher=Sky Sports |date=January 26, 2012 |accessdate=January 26, 2012}}</ref> He canceled his honeymoon so that he could sign for Bolton.<ref name="ReamHoneymoon">{{cite news |title=Honeymoon at the Reebok Stadium |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/archives/football/331172/honeymoon-at-the-reebok/ |publisher=The Sun |date=January 26, 2012 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> He was given the number 32 shirt and made his debut for the club in Bolton's 2–0 [[FA Cup]] win at [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] on February 18.<ref>{{cite news |title=Millwall 0 – 2 Bolton Wanderers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16994618? |publisher=BBC Sport |date=February 18, 2012 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> He made his Premier League debut the following weekend in Bolton's 3–0 defeat at [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Chelsea 3 – 0 Bolton Wanderers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17082758 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=February 25, 2012 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> On March 10, 2012, he assisted [[Darren Pratley]]'s opening goal in a 2–1 win over Queens Park Rangers.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bolton Wanderers 2 – 1 Queens Park Rangers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17243629 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=March 10, 2012 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> He went on to appear ten games straight towards the end of the season, but was unable to help the club survive relegation in the [[Premier League]].
For the start of the 2012–13 season, Ream was given the number 5 shirt, previously worn by [[Gary Cahill]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/article/squad-numbers-announced-5.6.12-217943.aspx |title=Squad Numbers Announced |publisher=Bolton Wanderers F.C. |date=July 5, 2012 |accessdate=July 1, 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141227211807/http://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/article/squad-numbers-announced-5.6.12-217943.aspx |archivedate=December 27, 2014 |deadurl=no}}</ref> He was given his first start of the 2012–13 season in a 2–0 loss against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Burnley 2 – 0 Bolton Wanderers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19221523 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=August 18, 2012 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> However, he was sidelined from the first team, due to losing his starting place<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/article/glad-to-be-back-22.10.12-439687.aspx |title=Glad To Be Back |publisher=Bolton Wanderers F.C. |date=October 22, 2012 |accessdate=July 1, 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121024221419/http://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/article/glad-to-be-back-22.10.12-439687.aspx |archivedate=October 24, 2012 |deadurl=no}}</ref> and was relegated to the substitutes bench. Despite this, Ream went on to make fifteen appearances.
Ahead of the 2013–14 season, Ream was linked with a move to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]], a move that was denied by the club and Ream.<ref>{{cite news |title=US star Tim Ream ready to learn new trade with Bolton Wanderers |url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/news/10554989.US_star_Tim_Ream_ready_to_learn_new_trade_with_Bolton_Wanderers/ |publisher=The Bolton News |date=July 18, 2013 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> After appearing the first three matches as an unused substitute, he started as defensive midfielder for four matches in September.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tim looks for first team spot |url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/news/10634103.Tim_looks_for_first_team_spot/ |publisher=The Bolton News |date=August 26, 2013 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> In early February 2014, he was forced to wear a protective mask in Wanderers games after a collision with [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] striker [[Charlie Austin]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Tim Ream injury sparks defensive dilemma at Bolton Wanderers |url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/news/10969799.Tim_Ream_injury_sparks_defensive_dilemma_at_Bolton_Wanderers/ |publisher=The Bolton News |date=January 29, 2014 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> Throughout the 2013–14 season, Ream played in the left–back position and center–back, where he established his partnership with [[Matt Mills]]<ref>{{cite news |title=Dougie Freedman hails Bolton Wanderers standard bearers Matt Mills and Tim Ream |url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/news/10732074.Dougie_Freedman_hails_Bolton_Wanderers_standard_bearers_Matt_Mills_and_Tim_Ream/ |publisher=The Bolton News |date=October 11, 2013 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> and redeemed himself in the first team making 42 appearances. At the end of that season, he was voted the fans' player of the year<ref>{{cite web |title=Tim Ream wins club's Player of the Year award |url=http://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/article/tim-ream-wins-clubs-player-of-the-year-award-1.5.14-1522314.aspx |publisher=bwfc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=May 1, 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140501235820/http://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/article/tim-ream-wins-clubs-player-of-the-year-award-1.5.14-1522314.aspx |archivedate=May 1, 2014 |deadurl=no}}</ref> and the club’s player of the year.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tim Ream wins player of the year award at Wanderers |url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/sport/11188532.Tim_Ream_wins_player_of_the_year_award_at_Wanderers/ |publisher=The Bolton News |date=May 2, 2014 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref>
Ahead of the 2014–15 season, on July 6, 2014, Ream signed a new three-year contract with Bolton that lasts until the summer of 2017.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sky Bet Championship: Bolton defender Tim Ream signs contract extension |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11672/9374061/sky-bet-championship-bolton-defender-tim-ream-signs-contract-extension |publisher=skysports.com |date=July 6, 2014 |accessdate=July 7, 2014}}</ref> Over the course of the season, he made a total of 44 appearances, missing two matches, one as an unused substitute against Derby County on September 27, 2014<ref>{{cite news |title=Bolton Wanderers 0 – 2 Derby County |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29289482 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=September 27, 2014 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> and one through injury.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/article/andrew-lonergan-and-tim-ream-cleared-of-serious-injury-2289209.aspx |title=Andrew Lonergan and Tim Ream cleared of serious injury |publisher=Bolton Wanderers F.C. |date=February 23, 2015 |accessdate=July 1, 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150225174214/http://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/article/andrew-lonergan-and-tim-ream-cleared-of-serious-injury-2289209.aspx |archivedate=February 25, 2015 |deadurl=no}}</ref> For the second season in a row, he was named as Bolton's player of the year.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/article/tim-ream-named-as-bolton-wanderers-201415-player-of-the-season-2432956.aspx |title=Tim Ream crowned 2014/15 Player of the Season |publisher=Bolton Wanderers F.C. |date=May 1, 2015 |accessdate=July 1, 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150502162455/http://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/article/tim-ream-named-as-bolton-wanderers-201415-player-of-the-season-2432956.aspx |archivedate=May 2, 2015 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
Ahead of the 2015–16 season, Ream was linked with a move to [[EFL Championship|Championship]] rivals [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]], who made a bid for him. However, the bid was rejected.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bolton sign Prince-Desir Gouano and reject QPR Tim Ream bid |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33802910 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=August 6, 2015 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref>
===Fulham=== [[File:Tim ream 2016.jpg|thumbnail|Ream playing for Fulham in 2016.]]
On August 20, 2015, Ream was sold to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], with whom he signed a four-year deal.<ref>{{cite news |title=American Tim Ream agrees four-year deal with Fulham – sources |url=http://www.espnfc.us/story/2569827/american-tim-ream-agrees-four-year-deal-with-fulham—sources |publisher=ESPN |date=August 20, 2015 |accessdate=August 20, 2015}}</ref> The move was undisclosed fee and has an option to extend his stay by a further year.<ref>{{cite news |title=Fulham have completed the signing of defender Tim Ream on a four-year deal from Bolton Wanderers |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11681/9958233/fulham-have-completed-the-signing-of-defender-tim-ream-on-a-four-year-deal-from-bolton |publisher=Sky Sports |date=August 20, 2015 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref>
He made his Fulham debut on August 29, 2015, in a 3–1 win over [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]], playing 90 minutes.<ref>{{cite news |title=Rotherham United 1–3 Fulham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34024911 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=August 29, 2015 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> He made 29 appearances for the club in his first season, partly due to international commitment<ref>{{cite news |title=Fulham new boy set to miss Huddersfield clash |url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-new-boy-set-miss-9904679 |publisher=Get West London |date=August 21, 2015 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> and injuries.<ref>{{cite news |title=Queens Park Rangers v Fulham: Whites missing defender for big derby clash |url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/qpr-v-fulham-whites-missing-10879026 |publisher=Get West London |date=February 12, 2016 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=American Exports: Tim Ream nearing return to Fulham lineup after hamstring injury |url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2015/10/23/american-exports-tim-ream-nearing-return-fulham-lineup-after-hamstring-injury |publisher=Major League Soccer Official Website |date=October 23, 2015 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> After initially playing as a center-back, he was used in the left-back position towards the end of the season, following the departure of [[James Husband (footballer)|James Husband]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Fulham boss weighing up where best to use Tim Ream – with Wolves clash in mind |url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-boss-weighing-up-best-10720564 |publisher=Get West London |date=January 12, 2016 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club in a 2–1 loss against [[Queens Park Rangers]] on October 1, 2016.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37460403 |title=Fulham 1–2 QPR |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=October 1, 2016 |accessdate=October 4, 2016}}</ref>
==International career== On November 11, 2010, Ream was called up to the [[United States men's national soccer team]] for the first time as part of an 18-man roster for a match against South Africa on November 17 in Cape Town.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ussoccer.com/News/Mens-National-Team/2010/11/Bradley-Names-18-Man-Roster-to-Face-South-Africa-on-Nov-17-in-Cape-Town.aspx |title=Bradley Names 18-Man Roster to Face South Africa on Nov. 17 in Cape Town |publisher=U.S. Soccer |date= |accessdate=January 26, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121003151903/http://www.ussoccer.com/News/Mens-National-Team/2010/11/Bradley-Names-18-Man-Roster-to-Face-South-Africa-on-Nov-17-in-Cape-Town.aspx |archivedate=October 3, 2012}}</ref> He made his international debut against [[South Africa national football team|South Africa]] on November 17, 2010. He started the match and played until the 67th minute before being replaced by [[Nat Borchers]]. The U.S. won 1–0 with the lone goal coming from fellow [[New York Red Bulls|Red Bull]] teammate [[Juan Agudelo]]. On January 22, 2011, he earned his second international cap against Chile in a 1–1 draw. He played all 90 minutes at center-back.
Ream started in their first game of the 2011 Gold Cup, a 2–0 win over [[Canada men's national soccer team|Canada]]. He also started the second match against Panama, which the U.S. lost 2–1 for their first ever loss in Gold Cup group play. In the 34th minute, he committed a foul on [[Blas Pérez]] resulting in a penalty kick for Panama. The penalty was converted by [[Gabriel Enrique Gómez|Gabriel Gómez]] and became the match-winner.<ref>{{cite news |title=U.S. FALLS TO PANAMA IN SECOND MATCH OF THE 2011 CONCACAF GOLD CUP |url=http://www.ussoccer.com/stories/2014/03/17/12/57/us-mnt-falls-to-panama-in-gold-cup-group-c-play |publisher=U.S. Soccer |date=June 11, 2011 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> In the next match, against Guadeloupe, he was replaced by [[Eric Lichaj]] and did not play in the final four matches of the 2011 Gold Cup.
After a two-year absence, Ream was again called into the U.S. national team in 2013<ref>{{cite news |title=Bolton Wanderers defender Tim Ream called up for USA friendly |url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/news/10607495.Bolton_Wanderers_defender_Tim_Ream_called_up_for_USA_friendly/ |publisher=The Bolton News |date=August 12, 2013 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> appearing as an unused substitute against [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] on August 14, 2013. On September 3, 2014, he played his first international match in three years, playing 45 minutes in a 1–0 win over [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Czech Republic 0, USA 1 – International Friendly Match Recap |url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2014/09/03/czech-republic-0-usa-1-international-friendly-match-recap |publisher=Major League Soccer Official Website |date=September 3, 2014 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref>
Ream also was called up for the [[2015 CONCACAF Gold Cup|2015 Gold Cup]] where he played all 90 minutes against the [[Haiti national football team|Haiti national team]] and helped preserve a 1–0 [[clean sheet]].<ref>{{cite news |title=KLINSMANN CALLS 23 PLAYERS TO DEFEND GOLD CUP TITLE |url=http://www.ussoccer.com/stories/2015/06/23/10/30/150623-mnt-gold-cup-roster-release |publisher=US Soccer |date=June 23, 2015 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> He scored his first international goal on May 22, 2016, in a friendly against [[Puerto Rico national football team|Puerto Rico]] at the [[Juan Ramón Loubriel Stadium]] in [[Bayamón, Puerto Rico|Bayamón]], [[Puerto Rico]].<ref>{{cite news |title=United States beats Puerto Rico with Tim Ream, Bobby Wood and own goals |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/report?gameId=448085 |publisher=ESPN |date=May 22, 2016 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref>
==Personal life== In January 2012, Ream married his childhood sweetheart Kristen Sapienza, who is also a soccer player.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ream keen on Bolton marriage |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11672/7443675/ream-keen-on-bolton-marriage |publisher=Sky Sports |date=January 20, 2012 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref> 24 hours after getting married Ream canceled his honeymoon planned in Tahiti to undergo a move to Bolton Wanderers.<ref name="ReamHoneymoon"/> Ream later stated in [[The Bolton News]] interview that he still made a right choice on canceling his honeymoon.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ream: I still made right choice |url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/news/9690569.Ream__I_still_made_right_choice/ |publisher=The Bolton News |date=May 5, 2012 |accessdate=July 1, 2016}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|January 12, 2019}}
Sources: *For English clubs:<ref name=sw>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/tim-ream/124014/ |title=United States – T. Ream |work=Soccerway |publisher=Global Sports Media |accessdate=January 26, 2012}} Figures under Career: Domestic cups tab.</ref> *For Major League Soccer, MLS Cup:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/players/tim-ream |title=Tim Ream |publisher=MLS Soccer |accessdate=January 26, 2012}}</ref> *For U.S. Open Cup:<ref name=sw/>
